title: Bristol airport opens £8.6m extension
text:
Bristol airport opens £8.6m extension 6 July 2015 Save 
Bristol airport has opened the first of two major extensions to its airport following a 12-month, £8.6 million investment. 
The additional space means the facility now has an enlarged departure lounge hosting more seating areas, shops and cafes and bars. 
A new outdoor terrace area has views of coming and going aircraft as well as bar and restaurant seating under a retractable roof. 
Work is also under way on the second terminal extension, which is expected to open next summer at a cost of £24 million. 
Upon completion the airport will have invested a total of £120 million on infrastructure since 2010. 
Robert Sinclair, Bristol airport chief executive, said: “More than 750,000 passengers are set to fly from Bristol during July and August alone, and we are confident they will be wowed by this new extension and the space, comfort and wider choice it provides. 
“Combined with the west terminal extension we recently announced, this development is a significant step towards achieving our vision to provide passengers from the south-west and Wales with a world-class customer experience when flying in and out of their local airport.” 
Other developments also underway include improvements to car parks and the construction of a 201 room Hampton by Hilton hotel set to be completed in 2016.
